messages: 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I changed a single word in the first paragraph of that clause, from SHOULD to MUST, and then added a non-normative note.  How can that possibly weaken anything?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:18): huh. the way you added the note made me interpret "same input" differently.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:19): That just means you have to define "same input" more precisely. ^^_
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:19): indeed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:19): i hadn't realised that might have been a source of the confusion
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:19): I'll cancel the email I was about to send and let you correct yourself.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:19): heh
70bfd0ae2cfbf2da192bddd569cf6132 (23:20): Did we settle on @alt?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:21): No, I'm still talking with one of our internal teams.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:21): Dude, it's been less than 24 hours.  ^_^
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:38): "I do not think a tautology machine would be a meaningful fulfillment of this success criterion."
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (23:38): We should ask the tautology machine for confirmation.
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:46): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I said that weeks ago!
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:46): did it become relevant again all of a sudden?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:46): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, yes, I'm catching up.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:46): No, I just started reading the backlog.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:47): Got totally messed up by Passover.  250ish spec mails and >500 MediaWiki commit mails.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:50): what happened to the wiki
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): hey, there's a mediawiki person here! how convenient :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:52): any idea what i should do?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:53): I have shell access as the wiki user, so, I'm looking.  :P
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:53): (someone gave it to me, can't remember who)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:53): Looks like a DB problem to me, not a MW problem.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:53): But let me see.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:53): well you have access to the db too if you have access to the shell :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:53): time for me to start changing passwords i guess :-P
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:54): (i'm fine with you having access, but, um, people, please let me know who you give access to :-P )
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:54): Interesting.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:55): Maybe it is a MediaWiki problem.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:55): Let me see if setting $wgCacheDirectory fixes it.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:56): i hope it was Lachy_ who gave you access
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:57): There we go, fixed.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:57): Apparently the new localization cache system isn't too reliable if you use a database backend.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:57): good to know
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:57): It's meant to use a filesystem-based cache, I think CDB or something.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:58): You can chown /home/whatwikiuser/wikicache to be webserver-writable but not world-writable, if you like (I just set 777).
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (23:58): (since, obviously, I can't do anything else)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:00): the server runs as the user
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): yeah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:01): should do anyway
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:01): Yeah, I see that now.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:05): thanks for fixing it btw! much appreciated
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:05): dunno what i would have done :-P
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:05): You could have asked for help in #mediawiki!
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:05): (although you probably wouldn't be running unreleased versions, so you probably wouldn't have hit the problem)
